content.question: (a) During the time interval <math alttext="delta t sub A B, end sub" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub></mstyle></math>, does the rate at which energy is dissipated by friction increase, decrease, or remain constant? Justify your answer without deriving equations.

frqParts.text: (a) During the time interval <math alttext="delta t sub A B, end sub" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub></mstyle></math>, does the rate at which energy is dissipated by friction increase, decrease, or remain constant? Justify your answer without deriving equations.

(b) Derive an expression for the total amount of energy dissipated by friction during the time interval <math alttext="delta t sub A B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub></mstyle></math>. Begin your derivation by writing a fundamental physics principle or an equation from the reference booklet.

(c) Describe the power output of the motor during the time interval <math alttext="delta t sub A B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>AB</mi></msub></mstyle></math>. Use your reasoning in part (a) to justify your claim.

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
